title: Indiana University Bloomington Graduate Library School Course Bulletin, Fall 1979
description: This 24-page bulletin would have been distributed to current and prospective Indiana University Bloomington Graduate Library School students ahead of the 1979-1980 academic year. It includes general information about the Graduate Library School as well as a list of degrees offered, courses offered, faculty/staff members, tuition rates, fee information, and a campus map. This was the first bulletin to include information about the Specialization in Music Librarianship (page 7) and the Seminar in Music Librarianship (page 13, course no. L631).
creator: Indiana University
subject: Course catalogs; Indiana University. Graduate Library School; Indiana University, Bloomington; Indiana University, Bloomington. Music Librarianship Program
location: Graduate Library School (Herman B. Wells Library, 1320 E 10th St, Bloomington, Indiana)

title: Report, 1968
description: This 5-page report details the findings of the Music Faculty Self-Study Committee on Libraries of the School of Music's evaluation of the Indiana University Bloomington Music Library. The report specifically focuses on findings in three main sections: I. Acquisition, II. Control of the collection, and III. Cataloguing the collection. title: Annual Report, Graduate Library School, Section 6: Plans for New Objectives, 1978-1979
description: This annual report was sent to Indiana University President John W. Ryan in order to provide a thorough overview of the current state and future goals of the Graduate Library School. While the entiret report is held at the Indiana University Archives, only the sixth section, "Plans for New Objectives" is relevant to the topic of this digital collection. The "Plans for New Objectives" section encompasses pages 15-17 of the the report. Page 16 mentions that the Graduate Library School is in the process of developing a program wiht the School of Music.

title: Brochure, "Music Collections at Indiana University", 2002
description: This promotional brochure provides an overview of the music collections at Indiana University Bloomington. It includes information about collections at the William and Gayle Cook Music Library, Latin American Music Center, Lilly Library, Archives of African American Music and Culture, Archives of Traditional Music, Mathers Museum of World Cultures, and Digital Library Program.
